content.html: Nice! The A11y plugin and progressive enhancement of swup really take care of the two most common concerns with page transitions, its a very well done library!

content.html: The problem seems to be that they have a static adapter but it needs to follow the settings for all adapters . Eg netlify needs a mixture of static, on demand and client. I'm sure they will sort but like Next they're coming at it from the opposite direction we want and astro does
content.text: The problem seems to be that they have a static adapter but it needs to follow the settings for all adapters . Eg netlify needs a mixture of static, on demand and client. I'm sure they will sort but like Next they're coming at it from the opposite direction we want and astro does

content.html: Useful post thanks. I just with played sveltekit expecting easy config of static, on demand and hydration at page level from the docs but it currently falls short. So back to astro and jsx it is :) useful to know you changed to all astro files.
content.text: Useful post thanks. I just with played sveltekit expecting easy config of static, on demand and hydration at page level from the docs but it currently falls short. So back to astro and jsx it is :) useful to know you changed to all astro files.

content.html: Thanks! That was the main motivation we had for giving Astro a shot as well. Our site doesn't need all the bells and whistles like client-side routing and we couldn't find a way to have SvelteKit output mostly static content. That said, its absolutely our go-to for large apps!
content.text: Thanks!  That was the main motivation we had for giving Astro a shot as well.  Our site doesn't need all the bells and whistles like client-side routing and we couldn't find a way to have SvelteKit output mostly static content.  That said, its absolutely our go-to for large apps!

content.html: That's pretty clever! I imagine you could do the same with Astro props pre prop-change, and now you can just destructure: ```js const { class: className } = Astro.props; console.log(className); ```

content.text:
Blog examples are all well and good, but how well does @astrodotbuild hold up against a more serious use case?

Add @snipcart into the mix and you have yourself a full #restaurant online ordering solution!

#JamStack @kamflyio

navillus.dev/blog/astro-plu‚Ä¶

content.html: Awesome post üëè We should give a try to @astrodotbuild üöÄ Minor feedback: 1. You could set /images as your default media folder instead of the default /uploads to further reduce the diff. 2. Authors could be stored as JSON file(s) instead of Markdown if you don't need a body.
content.text:
Awesome post üëè
We should give a try to @astrodotbuild üöÄ

Minor feedback:
1. You could set /images as your default media folder instead of the default /uploads to further reduce the diff. 
2. Authors could be stored as JSON file(s) instead of Markdown if you don't need a body.

content.html: Thanks for checking out the demo app, and for those excellent tips! I'm hoping to have a Part 2 of the demo out later this week highlighting HMR and how to rework the projects to build pages right from the CMS - I'll add your recommendations tot he list as well!
content.text:
Thanks for checking out the demo app, and for those excellent tips!

I'm hoping to have a Part 2 of the demo out later this week highlighting HMR and how to rework the projects to build pages right from the CMS - I'll add your recommendations tot he list as well!
